title: Issues
comment: Wish I could view the expanded versions of the examples. Apart from that, I love it! More apps please Zooniverse peeps ;)
Thanks. I see that problem now too. There's been another change on the server. I have fixed it in version 1.51.

title: Brilliant app
comment: More futhering of the species get done in my lunch and coffee breaks than get done in my job.  More zoo apps please

title: Cannot download new subjects
comment: I've been a member for a long time.  Now I cannot download new subjects
Thanks. The server changed again without warning. The new version 1.49 of the app should fix this.
Awesome!!!

title: Best game ever!
comment: Bored playing games that don't directly contribute to the betterment of our species? Fans of humanity unite! This MMOPPG is suitable for all ages and creeds. Tired of Faraday hogging all the cool discoveries? Give this a whirl and classify a twirl! 5 billion people will thank you.
Why doesn't skyserver work?

Thanks. Do you mean the "View on SkyServer" link on web pages such as this: http://www.galaxyzoo.org/#/examine/AGZ0007y34 ? Sorry, but the app has no control over what appears on the "Discuss" and "Examine" web pages. However, this seems to be a known issue with the website: https://github.com/zooniverse/Galaxy-Zoo/issues/194

title: Great app anymore?
comment: Great app. Waiting for similar apps for other zoo projects.

title: I like this app a lot
comment: Very cool app, I like how you can review list and see inverted image fast and easy

title: Need update to fix bugs
comment: Keeps freezing and kicking off
Please use Android's Report button if Android says that the app is unresponsive. Then I can get some clue about what might be happening. Thanks.

title: Love Zooniverse
comment: And this app, but I try to login and it won't stay logged in. As soon as I log in, opening the options shows I have to log in again.  Sync doesn't make a difference.

Thanks. There's no way that it would show you that you are not logged in. It just lets you login again, for instance as a different user. I guess it's working fine for you though I can understand your confusion. Maybe we should change "Log In" to a "Log Out" menu item after you are logged in: https://github.com/murraycu/android-galaxyzoo/issues/18
Had trouble logging in at first but realised you have to turn sync on for the app . Great app, so pleased Galaxy Zoo has come to android!

Thanks. It shouldn't be necessary to turn sync on but maybe there's some situation that I have not seen so far. If anybody else experiences this problem then please do file an Issue here so we can figure out how to fix it: https://github.com/murraycu/android-galaxyzoo/issues

title: Awesome
comment: Please add the option to download the image.
OK. Done: https://github.com/murraycu/android-galaxyzoo/commit/6e0caeecef233524ab73e34ac08105e0c2ddec59

title: Great app
comment: Everyone should contribute .. and the galaxies are so cool to look at.

title: At last!
comment: I can see this being my all time favourite app! Would be nice to have an undo last action button though. Keep up the good work ! I hope you'll be  making more space research apps in the future!
Thanks. There is a Reset icon (or menu item, depending on your device) which takes you back to the start of your classification.
Great app!

title: NOT a zoo
comment: Excellent app using data from galaxy zoo, part of the Zooniverse project. Hoping that a planet identification module will be added

title: Easy quick alternative to the browser projects.
comment: Current version doesn't provide great complete examples, had to go to forums for specific info.

Thanks. The examples text and images should be exactly the same as the website version so if you can identify a particular problem, please, I'd really like to fix it: https://github.com/murraycu/android-galaxyzoo/issues . Maybe the website's help is lacking too and maybe they'd like to hear about it: https://github.com/zooniverse/Galaxy-Zoo/issues

title: Excellent citizen science app, but a little buggy
comment: Would that every zooniverse project had a mobile application like this. Even though there are a few bugs, I'll put up with them to participate in this work. I'm delighted to have galaxy zoo on my phone. I just hope my classification data is making it back to the scientists overseeing this project so they can use it.

Thanks. Please do report any crashes via the Report button. And please let me know about any bugs here so I can try to fix them:
https://github.com/murraycu/android-galaxyzoo/issues .

You can confirm that your classifications have been properly uploaded by looking at your profile here:
http://www.galaxyzoo.org/#/profile
